ttl.name: TORQUE CONVERTER CLUTCH AND DRIVE PLATE

s3.ptxt: Install SST to the inner race of the 1-way clutch.
Set SST so that it fits in the notch of the converter hub and in the outer race of the 1-way clutch.
With the torque converter standing on its side, check that the clutch locks when SST is turned counterclockwise and rotates freely and smoothly when SST is turned clockwise.
If the results are not as specified, clean the converter and recheck the 1-way clutch.
If the results still are not as specified even after cleaning the converter, replace the converter.

s2.ptxt: Determine the condition of the torque converter clutch.

s3.ptxt: Check that the following conditions are met:

item.ptxt: During the stall test or when the shift lever is on N, metallic sounds are not emitted from the torque converter clutch.
The 1-way clutch turns in one direction and locks in the other direction.
The amount of powder in the ATF is not greater than the sample shown in the illustration.

s3.ptxt: If the results are not as specified, replace the torque converter clutch assembly.

atten4.ptxt: The sample illustration shows approximately 0.25 liters (0.26 US qts, 0.22 Imp. qts) of the ATF taken from a removed torque converter clutch.

s2.ptxt: Replace the ATF in the torque converter clutch.

s3.ptxt: If the ATF is discolored and/or has a foul odor, stir the ATF in the torque converter clutch thoroughly and drain the ATF with the torque converter facing up.

s2.ptxt: Clean and check the oil cooler and oil pipe line.

s3.ptxt: If the torque converter clutch is inspected or the ATF is replaced, clean the oil cooler and oil pipe line.

item.ptxt: Apply 196 kPa (2 kgf/cm2, 28 psi) of compressed air to the inlet hose.
If a large amount of powder is found in the ATF, add new ATF using a bucket pump and clean the oil cooler and oil pipe line again.

s3.ptxt: If the ATF is cloudy, inspect the oil cooler (radiator).

s2.ptxt: Prevent deformation of the torque converter clutch and damage to the oil pump gear.

s3.ptxt: When any marks due to interference are found on the end of a bolt for the torque converter clutch and on the bottom of the bolt hole, replace the bolt and torque converter clutch.
Make sure all of the bolts are the same length.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT DRIVE PLATE AND RING GEAR

s2.ptxt: Set up a dial indicator and measure the runout of the 6 portions around the torque converter fitting surfaces.
If the runout is more than the maximum or if the ring gear is damaged, replace the drive plate (See page ).
